requirement_tested: Frontend application with pages for browsing, searching, filtering, and booking apartments
user_persona: A traveler looking for a short-term apartment rental.
user_goal: Browse available apartments and navigate to the apartment detail page.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah visits the homepage and sees the navigation bar with links to different sections.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Apartments' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The apartment listing page loads, showing a grid of available apartments.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Apartment Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah finds an apartment she likes and clicks on the apartment card to see more details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The apartment detail page loads, displaying comprehensive information and images.

requirement_tested: Backend API service to manage apartment data, bookings, and user interactions
user_goal: Verify that the backend API serves apartment data correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching Apartment Data
narrative_steps.description: The frontend makes a request to the backend to retrieve apartment listings.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: API responds with a list of apartments in JSON format.

requirement_tested: PostgreSQL database connection using environment variables: DB_HOST, DB_PORT, DB_USERNAME, DB_PASSWORD, DB_NAME
user_persona: A DevOps engineer deploying the application.
user_goal: Ensure the backend connects to the PostgreSQL database using correct environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: The backend service initializes and attempts to connect to the database.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend service with environment variables set.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Service successfully connects to PostgreSQL database using provided credentials.

requirement_tested: Apartment listing page displaying available apartments with key details
user_goal: View a list of available apartments with key details.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Apartment Listings
narrative_steps.description: John clicks on the 'Apartments' link to see available rentals.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the apartment listing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page displays a grid of apartment cards with thumbnails, titles, locations, prices, and ratings.

requirement_tested: Search functionality allowing users to find apartments by location, dates, and other criteria
user_persona: A user planning a trip to a specific city.
user_goal: Find apartments in a specific location using the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Using Search Bar
narrative_steps.description: Emily wants to find apartments in Paris. She types 'Paris' into the search bar.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'Paris' into the search bar and click 'Search'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page updates to show apartments located in Paris.

requirement_tested: Filter options for refining apartment searches by price, amenities, type, and availability

narrative_steps.title: Opening Filter Panel
narrative_steps.description: David clicks the filter icon to refine his search results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Filter options panel expands below the search bar.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Price Filter
narrative_steps.description: David sets a maximum nightly rate of $100 and applies the filter.
narrative_steps.action: Set max price to $100 and apply filters.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: List updates to show only apartments within the specified price range.

requirement_tested: Apartment detail page showing comprehensive information, images, and pricing
user_goal: Review detailed information and images of an apartment.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Apartment Details
narrative_steps.description: Lisa clicks on an apartment card to learn more about it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Apartment detail page loads with photo gallery, description, amenities, and pricing.

requirement_tested: Booking system enabling users to select dates and submit rental requests
user_persona: A user ready to make a reservation.
user_goal: Select dates and submit a booking request for an apartment.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Booking Process
narrative_steps.description: Michael clicks the 'Book Now' button on an apartment detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Booking form modal or page appears with date selection and guest count.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Booking Request
narrative_steps.description: Michael selects his stay dates and clicks submit.
narrative_steps.action: Select dates and click the submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Form submits successfully and redirects to a confirmation page.

requirement_tested: User authentication and session management for secure booking and record access
user_goal: Log in to access personal booking records.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Anna clicks the login button and enters her credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Click login button, enter email and password, then click 'Login'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: User is authenticated and redirected to their account dashboard.

requirement_tested: Booking history page where users can view their past and upcoming reservations
user_persona: A frequent renter checking previous stays.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Booking History
narrative_steps.description: Robert navigates to the bookings page to see his reservation history.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Bookings' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Booking history page loads, displaying a list of past and upcoming reservations.

requirement_tested: Admin interface or capability for managing apartment listings and bookings
user_goal: Add a new apartment listing through the admin interface.

narrative_steps.title: Adding New Apartment
narrative_steps.description: Admin accesses the admin dashboard and initiates adding a new apartment.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Add New Apartment' in the admin panel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Blank form for entering apartment details appears.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Apartment Listing
narrative_steps.description: Admin fills out the form and saves the new listing.
narrative_steps.action: Fill form fields and click save.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New apartment is added to the database and visible in listings.

requirement_tested: Responsive design optimized for desktop and mobile browsing experiences
user_goal: Browse apartments seamlessly on a mobile device.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Site on Mobile
narrative_steps.description: Emma opens the website on her smartphone to look for apartments.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the homepage on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Site layout adjusts responsively to fit the mobile screen size.

requirement_tested: Visual styling with linen background and maroon-colored interactive components
user_goal: Confirm that the site uses the correct background and accent colors.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Visual Design
narrative_steps.description: Designer checks the homepage for correct background texture and interactive element colors.
narrative_steps.action: Load homepage and inspect visual elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Background displays linen texture; interactive elements use maroon color on hover/click.

requirement_tested: Package.json configuration with 'install:all' script for simultaneous frontend and backend dependency installation
user_persona: Developer setting up the project locally.
user_goal: Install dependencies for both frontend and backend simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Running Install Script
narrative_steps.description: Developer runs the unified install command to set up the project.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently without errors.

requirement_tested: Development setup with 'dev' script to run frontend and backend concurrently
user_goal: Start both frontend and backend servers with one command.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer uses the convenience script to launch both services.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run dev' from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start concurrently and are accessible.
